text: Talk With a Dietitian   Make a food plan that reduces the potassium in your diet. Start by noting the high-potassium foods (below) that you now eat. A dietitian can help you add other foods to the list.           High-Potassium Foods               apricots avocados bananas beets Brussels sprouts cantaloupe clams dates figs     kiwi fruit lima beans melons milk nectarines orange juice oranges peanuts pears (fresh)     potatoes prune juice prunes raisins sa
